content:
Congratulations on taking the first step towards reducing your screen time! There are many apps and tools that can help you track and limit your social media usage. Here are some recommendations:

1. **Freedom**: This app blocks distracting websites and apps across all your devices, including social media sites, during your set productivity hours. It also tracks your screen time and provides detailed reports. (Web, iOS, Android)
2. **RescueTime**: This app tracks how you spend your time on your devices, providing detailed reports on your productivity, time spent on social media, and other activities. It also offers features to block distracting websites and set alerts. (Web, iOS, Android)
3. **StayFocusd**: A browser extension that blocks social media sites during your set productivity hours. You can customize the blocked sites, set a daily time limit, and even set a "Focus Mode" to block all distracting sites. (Chrome, Firefox)
4. **Moment**: An app that tracks your screen time, providing detailed reports on your social media usage, app usage, and overall screen time. It also offers features to set daily limits, schedule screen-free times, and track your progress. (iOS, Android)
5. **Cold Turkey**: A website blocker that helps you stay focused by blocking distracting sites, including social media, during your set productivity hours. It also tracks your productivity and provides detailed reports. (Windows, Mac)
6. **SelfControl**: A free, open-source app for Mac that blocks distracting websites, including social media, for a set period. It's a simple, no-nonsense solution to help you stay focused.
7. **Forest**: A gamified productivity app that grows a virtual forest as you stay focused on your tasks. If you leave the app or get distracted, your forest withers. It also tracks your screen time and provides daily reports. (iOS, Android)
8. **Screen Time Parental Control**: If you have an iPhone, you can use the built-in Screen Time feature to set app limits, schedule downtime, and track your screen time. You can also set up a "Screen Time Passcode" to lock your settings.

To help you reduce your social media usage by 30 minutes daily, you can try the following:

* Set a daily limit for social media usage using one of the apps above.
* Schedule social media-free hours or blocks of time during your peak productivity hours.
* Remove social media apps from your phone's home screen or move them to a folder on your home screen to reduce temptation.
* Replace social media time with a healthier habit, such as reading, exercise, or meditation.
* Set reminders or notifications to remind you to take breaks from social media throughout the day.

Remember, the key to reducing screen time is to set realistic goals, track your progress, and find healthier alternatives to fill your time. Good luck!
